author: Staff Reporter
text:
: The President of India has consented to the recommendation made by the Chief Justice of India (CJI) T.S. Thakur to transfer Madras High Court Judge Justice C.S. Karnan to the Calcutta High Court.

Confirming the development, a high court official said, “Justice Karnan has been directed to join the Calcutta High Court on or before March 11, 2016. We have received a fax message to this effect.”

Responding in an unprecedented manner to the transfer recommendation made by the CJI, Justice Karnan on February 15 suo motu stayed his transfer and requested the CJI to explain the reason for his action through a written statement.

Subsequently, on an urgent plea moved by the Registry of the Madras High Court, a Division Bench of Justice Khehar and Justice R. Banumathi stayed all orders issued by Justice Karnan from February 12.

On February 16, the ChiefJusticeof Madras High Court S.K. Kaul decided not to allocate any work to Justice Karnan, exercising the option given by the Supreme Court that it is up to him to decide whether or not to assign future work to the judge.
title: President gives nod for Karnan’s transfer
